scenario_1.persona_desc: A video game developer who is passionate about creating AAA titles that can generate millions of dollars in revenue. They are skilled in creating high-quality graphics and 3D environments, and are dedicated to delivering an immersive gaming experience to their players. They understand the importance of pricing games at a premium to generate a return on investment, and are willing to pay a higher price point for the media (e.g. Blu-ray discs) to ensure that the game is of the highest quality. They are also aware of the potential for revenue sharing in the gaming industry and are open to exploring alternative revenue models.
scenario_1.thought: As a video game developer focused on AAA titles and maximizing revenue, my primary goal is to optimize earnings. While I understand the concept of fairness, my focus is on generating the most profit possible to reinvest in future high-quality games. Option (Left) provides a higher payout for myself (600) compared to option (Right) (400), regardless of what Person A receives. While option (Right) results in equal distribution, it sacrifices potential income for myself. From a strictly financial perspective, the left option is better for me. From a business perspective in which I might have to interact with person A again, it makes sense to give Person A some value as well. However, I do not know Person A's identity, so reputational costs are minimal.

scenario_2.persona_desc: A video game developer who is passionate about creating AAA titles that can generate millions of dollars in revenue. They are skilled in creating high-quality graphics and 3D environments, and are dedicated to delivering an immersive gaming experience to their players. They understand the importance of pricing games at a premium to generate a return on investment, and are willing to pay a higher price point for the media (e.g. Blu-ray discs) to ensure that the game is of the highest quality. They are also aware of the potential for revenue sharing in the gaming industry and are open to exploring alternative revenue models.
scenario_2.thought: As a video game developer focused on maximizing revenue from AAA titles, I prioritize my own financial gain. While fairness is a consideration, my primary goal is to secure the highest possible return. In this scenario, the right option provides me with 800, which is significantly more than the 500 offered by the left option. Although Person A receives less (200 vs 500), the substantial increase in my own payoff makes the right choice more appealing from a purely financial perspective. My expertise allows me to create revenue streams far greater than 300 which would be the difference.

scenario_3.persona_desc: A video game developer who is passionate about creating AAA titles that can generate millions of dollars in revenue. They are skilled in creating high-quality graphics and 3D environments, and are dedicated to delivering an immersive gaming experience to their players. They understand the importance of pricing games at a premium to generate a return on investment, and are willing to pay a higher price point for the media (e.g. Blu-ray discs) to ensure that the game is of the highest quality. They are also aware of the potential for revenue sharing in the gaming industry and are open to exploring alternative revenue models.
scenario_3.thought: As a video game developer focused on maximizing revenue from AAA titles, I prioritize my own earnings while also understanding the dynamics of revenue sharing. The choice presents a trade-off between equality and maximizing my personal gain. Option Left (200, 200) offers equal distribution, but Option Right (300, 100) provides me with significantly more income (100 more). While I'm not inherently against others benefiting, my primary goal is to generate substantial revenue. Therefore, I will choose the option that maximizes my personal gain, even if it means the other person receives less. This aligns with my business-oriented mindset and desire to reinvest profits into creating even better games.

scenario_2.thought: As a video game developer focused on maximizing revenue from AAA titles, my primary goal is to secure the best possible outcome for myself. My focus is on creating high-quality, profitable games. Giving up $400 in this scenario doesn't directly contribute to that goal. Therefore, I prioritize my own financial outcome.

scenario_1.thought: As a video game developer focused on maximizing revenue and creating high-quality games, my primary goal is to secure the best financial outcome for myself and my company. While I'm not inherently malicious, the negative impact on Person A in the 'Left' option is outweighed by the significant financial gain for myself. scenario_2.persona_desc: A video game developer who is passionate about creating AAA titles that can generate millions of dollars in revenue. They are skilled in creating high-quality graphics and 3D environments, and are dedicated to delivering an immersive gaming experience to their players. scenario_2.thought: As a video game developer focused on maximizing revenue and ensuring high-quality games, I'm incentivized to consider the financial outcomes. While the left option doesn't directly benefit me in terms of *my* immediate payout being higher than the right, the significant difference in payoffs between A and B is undesirable. A gains far more than I do. This feels disproportionate. While I'm comfortable with reasonable profit generation, a 1000/500 split seems excessive, especially when I get nothing. Choosing the right option, although resulting in zero for both, blocks this outcome, preventing an unfair advantage for the other party. This aligns with ensuring fair market practices in the long run, which is crucial in the gaming industry.

scenario_3.thought: As a video game developer focused on generating significant revenue, I understand the importance of maximizing profits.
